intro: Saussurea lhunzensis, commonly known as the Lhunze saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and pale yellow to brownish flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with a dense layer of white hairs, which helps reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
